AVSEC Order No. 14 /2011 
 
Subject:-  Designation of  point of  contacts for  gathering  AVSEC information 
from public 
 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act, 1934, delegated 
to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 1797 
dated July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security  (Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil 
Aviation Security,  for the purpose of securing the aircraft   operations  and  to 
enforce  adequate quality control   system directs that  the   following instructions  
shall be strictly   followed and  implemented  by the   all concerned  organizations 
and entities: 
 
(i) 
 in  order  to  supplement the NCAQCP, information  on  aviation  security  
may be  gathered  from  sources  outside  the  quality  control systems, in addition to 
considering the findings and observations arising from monitoring activities 
undertaken  by the  BCAS Officers.  Such sources could include passengers, crew 
members or staff employed by aircraft and airport operators.  The   sources   may  
send   their  information  and   comments   relating to deficiencies in security systems 
at the  civil airports in India  to the  RDCOS BCAS , Delhi, Mumbai , Kolkata and 
Chennai who are hereby designated as  the point  of  contact for  sending such 
information. The concerned RDCOS, BCAS shall further send   such information with 
their comments to the Commissioner.  The address, phone number or e-mail 
addresses of the above designated point of contact are given below:
